Distance traveled by the bus as a function of time is d_b = t^2/2.
Pedestrian starts 36 meters behind the bus.
Pedestrian will catch up if 8t = t^2/2 + 36.
Use quadratic formula to solve t = (16 ± √(256 - 288))/2.
Discriminant is negative, so no real solutions for t.
Negative discriminant indicates pedestrian will never catch up with the bus.
